snippet: America reacted to the 1972 massacre of Israelis in Munich by labeling all Palestinian nationalists as terrorists — a mistake that delayed the peace process by decades.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Paul Thomas Chamberlin, in light of the 40th anniversary of the terrorist attacks at the 1972 Olympic Games, argues that is important to maintain diplomatic connections to terrorist groups; contends that by effectively locking the Palestinian Liberation Organization out of the Arab-Israeli peace process, American officials sidelined potential peacemakers and pushed Palestinian national ambitions to the back burner.
lead_paragraph: America reacted to the 1972 massacre of Israelis in Munich by labeling all Palestinian nationalists as terrorists — a mistake that delayed the peace process by decades.

headline.seo: When It Pays to Talk to Terrorists
headline.main: When It Pays to Talk to Terrorists
headline.print_headline: When It Pays To Talk to Terrorists
